turns.content: Can you explain how to configure the settings for automatic updates on your Android smartphone?

Sure! Here's a step-by-step guide on how to configure the settings for automatic updates on your Android smartphone:

1. Open the "Google Play Store" app on your Android smartphone.

2. Tap on the three horizontal lines (also known as the "hamburger" menu) in the top left corner of the screen.

3. From the menu that appears, select "Settings."

4. Scroll down to the "General" section and tap on "Auto-update apps."

5. You'll now see three options - "Do not auto-update apps," "Auto-update apps over any network," and "Auto-update apps over Wi-Fi only." Select the option that works best for you.

6. If you choose "Auto-update apps over Wi-Fi only," make sure your smartphone is connected to a Wi-Fi network.

7. If you want to disable automatic updates altogether, select "Do not auto-update apps."

And that's it! You've successfully configured the settings for automatic updates on your Android smartphone.
Can you tell me how to check which apps have been updated automatically?

Yes, I can help you with that. Here's how to check which apps have been updated automatically on your Android smartphone:

1. Open the "Google Play Store" app on your Android smartphone. 2. Tap on the three horizontal lines (also known as the "hamburger" menu) in the top left corner of the screen. 3. From the menu that appears, select "My apps & games." 4. You'll see two tabs - "Updates" and "Installed." The "Updates" tab displays all the apps that have been updated or have pending updates. 5. The apps that have been updated automatically will have a tag that says "Updated" next to them. 6. If you want to see the update history of a particular app, tap on the app and scroll down to the "Version history" section. And that's it! You can now check which apps have been updated automatically on your Android smartphone.
Wow, that was easier than I expected. I'm glad I don't have to manually update my apps anymore.

Yes, automatic updates can be very convenient and save you a lot of time. However, it's always a good idea to keep an eye on your updates just in case there are any issues or bugs with the latest version of an app.
